alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Lafourche; Plaquemines; St. Bernard (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 09 at 2:14AM CST until January 09 at 3:30AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: The National Weather Service in New Orleans has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern St. Bernard Parish in southeastern Louisiana... Southeastern Lafourche Parish in southeastern Louisiana... Southeastern Jefferson Parish in southeastern Louisiana... Plaquemines Parish in southeastern Louisiana... * Until 330 AM CST. * At 214 AM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Poydras to 9 miles northeast of Leeville, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Port Sulphur, Myrtle Grove, Boothville-venice, Boothville, Pointe A La Hache, Empire, Buras, Buras-triumph, Venice, Poydras, Boothville Asos, and Grand Isle. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CST for southeastern Louisiana.
